tasks: Create a simple wireframe of a login screen using the 8-point grid system, focusing on typography and color scheme.
Write down 5 common errors that occur during user research and validation, and brainstorm ways to mitigate them.
Sketch out 3 possible solutions for a common pain point in your own life or a friend's, using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework.
Redesign your existing wireframes from Week 1 to improve typography and color scheme.
Conduct 1 user interview and document 3 pain points using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework, focusing on a specific user persona.
Create a simple usability test plan for a hypothetical app feature, including 5 possible scenarios and expected outcomes.
Design a new wireframe for a common UI element (e.g. button, form field) using the 10 Usability Heuristics as a guide.
Create a user research plan for a hypothetical product feature, including 2 possible personas and 5 research questions.
Sketch out 3 possible solutions for a complex design problem using Occam's Razor and the Aesthetic-Usability Effect.
Redesign your entire portfolio website using the Laws of UX as a guide, including typography, color scheme, and layout.
Conduct 2 user interviews and document 5 pain points using the Zeigarnik Effect to create a compelling narrative.
Create a comprehensive design system for a hypothetical app or product feature, including guidelines for typography, color scheme, and layout.

resources.readup: As an Explorer UX designer, you have the unique opportunity to craft a user's first impression of a product or service. To excel in this role, focus on building your skills in UI Craft & Visual Design, User Research & Validation, and Product Thinking & Strategy, while also honing your Collaboration & Communication skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Applying Occam's Razor for Simplified UI Design
topics.summary: Mastering Occam's Razor will help you eliminate unnecessary design elements and create a more intuitive user experience.
practice_points: Create 3 wireframes of a simple login form, applying Occam's Razor to reduce the number of form fields by 50% while maintaining functionality
Conduct an A/B test with 2 versions of a UI element (e.g., button size) and document the results using a decision tree diagram
Write a blog post explaining how Occam's Razor can be applied to UX design, including examples from your own work or industry research

topics.name: User Research with the Jobs-to-be-Done Framework
topics.summary: Using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework will help you uncover users' underlying motivations and create a more empathetic design approach.
practice_points: Conduct 2 user interviews using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework, documenting findings in a spreadsheet or note-taking app
Create a user persona based on your research, including job descriptions, goals, and pain points
Develop a survey to gather more data on users' motivations and behaviors, with clear instructions and follow-up questions

topics.name: Visual Design Principles: Aesthetic-Usability Effect
topics.summary: Understanding the Aesthetic-Usability Effect will help you create visually appealing designs that also improve user experience.
practice_points: Design 3 color palettes for a hypothetical website, applying the principles of the Aesthetic-Usability Effect to ensure contrast and readability
Create a visual design system with typography guidelines, spacing recommendations, and color tokens
Develop a mood board or inspiration board to explore how different design elements can evoke emotions and improve user engagement
